channel.title: Comments on: Fitbit Flex, dead and won’t charge?

item.title: By: nkb
item.dc:creator: nkb
item.description: didn't work. connectors clean. totally dead. contacted fitbit. no help.
item.content:encoded: didn’t work. connectors clean. totally dead. contacted fitbit. no help.

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1933/comment-page-1#comment-45777">christian</a>.
It's not on the fitbit itself. It's in the charging cradle near the bottom of the back. Just a small round hole.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to christian.

It’s not on the fitbit itself. It’s in the charging cradle near the bottom of the back. Just a small round hole.

item.title: By: christian
item.dc:creator: christian
item.description: cant find the pinhole, please help

item.title: By: Womey
item.dc:creator: Womey
item.description: Thanks. Although the RESET button did not help this time, I did clean the contact (inside the charger); normally I only have to clean the fitBit's contacts (not the charger's) - but good to know about that reset feature. Lights are a'blinkin' good now 8-)
item.content:encoded: Thanks. Although the RESET button did not help this time, I did clean the contact (inside the charger); normally I only have to clean the fitBit’s contacts (not the charger’s) – but good to know about that reset feature. Lights are a’blinkin’ good now 8-)

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1933/comment-page-1#comment-44023">Christa</a>.
That's a good idea too. We've used a cotton-swab and cleaned the contacts as well with some success.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Christa.

That’s a good idea too. We’ve used a cotton-swab and cleaned the contacts as well with some success.

item.title: By: Christa
item.dc:creator: Christa
item.description: I've had issues charging my fitbit as well and realized there was some corrosion or stuff covering the connectors (I'm assuming from sweat, condensation, etc.) I took a paperclip & scraped all that away and it is charging fine now!
item.content:encoded: I’ve had issues charging my fitbit as well and realized there was some corrosion or stuff covering the connectors (I’m assuming from sweat, condensation, etc.) I took a paperclip & scraped all that away and it is charging fine now!

item.title: By: Tammy Chavera
item.dc:creator: Tammy Chavera
item.description: Thank you very much, this totally Worked for me!!!!
item.content:encoded: Thank you very much, this totally Worked for me!!!!

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1933/comment-page-1#comment-43248">molly</a>.
Eventually, my wife's fitbit failed completely and it was replaced under warranty (it has a 1 year warranty).
item.content:encoded:
In reply to molly.

Eventually, my wife’s fitbit failed completely and it was replaced under warranty (it has a 1 year warranty).

item.title: By: molly
item.dc:creator: molly
item.description: Nothing is working for me I have tried this once before and it worked but not today and it is super tiring, does anyone have any suggestions?
item.content:encoded: Nothing is working for me I have tried this once before and it worked but not today and it is super tiring, does anyone have any suggestions?
